newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar finishes lower on China worries.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar finishes lower on China worries.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar ended lower on Tuesday as worries over the island's ties with China triggered active investor flight to the U.S. dollar, dealers said.

The local unit ended at its intra-day low of T$27.519 against Monday's T$27.485 close. Turnover was an active US$298 million. Many investors were concerned that a secret journey by Vice-President Lien Chan could anger Beijing, dealers said.

"A persistent inflow of foreign equity funds has become the main, if not the only, support for the Taiwan dollar, but that didn't happen today," said one dealer. A range of T$27.51-58 was seen for Wednesday. -- Alice Hung (2-5080815)
